title: Punjabi businessman shot dead in Canada: 3rd incident in 8 months
content: A Punjabi businessman, Binder Garcha, was shot dead in Surrey, Canada. This incident follows similar killings of prominent Punjabi businessmen in the region. Garcha owned a wedding photography and videography business. Authorities are investigating the crime, with a burnt vehicle found. The community is alarmed by these targeted attacks.

title: Cold wave freezes Delhi-NCR: IMD issues 'yellow' alert; flight ops impacted
content: Delhi woke up to dense fog and cold wave conditions on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department issued a yellow alert. Some relief is expected from Friday as temperatures are set to rise. A feeble western disturbance will approach, pushing up night temperatures. Fresh snowfall is likely in the Himalayan region around January 16. Delhi's air quality remains very poor.

title: Bangladesh cricket in turmoil: Players threaten boycott; BCB disowns director's remarks
content: Bangladesh cricket faces turmoil as a BCB director's remarks spark player boycott threats and jeopardize World Cup participation. The board distanced itself from the comments, emphasizing player welfare, while security concerns over playing in India persist. Former players and associations condemned the public criticism, highlighting damage to the sport's image.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Budget 2026: Industry flags customs litigation, compliance bottlenecks as key pain points
content: Despite broader government pushes under the Digital India programme, customs adjudication and litigation remain heavily paper-driven. Businesses are still required to file physical replies to show cause notices.

title: CBSE invites schools to join UPU 2026 letter writing competition - check details
content: CBSE has invited its affiliated schools to participate in the 55th UPU International Letter Writing Competition 2026, organised by the Department of Posts. Students are asked to write letters on the theme of why human connection matters in a digital world. The competition aims to foster creativity, writing skills, and global friendship, with top entries advancing to the international stage.

title: Trip.com monopoly investigation: China launches probe into alleged market abuse
content: China's market regulator is investigating travel giant Trip.com for suspected monopoly violations. Officials are examining if the company, a major player in online bookings, misused its dominant position. This probe follows Beijing's earlier crackdowns on tech giants, aiming to ensure fair competition and prevent practices like coercive clauses and arbitrary commission hikes.

title: BCB says players, not board, will lose money if it pulls out from T20 WC
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board's finance chief stated the board won't face financial loss if the team withdraws from the T20 World Cup, attributing potential losses to players' match fees and bonuses. He emphasized that the board's revenue is secured until 2027, dismissing compensation for players.

title: 'Dhurandhar' day 41: Film gives tough competition to 'The Raja Saab'
content: 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, continues its phenomenal box office run, nearing its sixth week. The film has shattered records since its December 5 release, now challenging 'The Raja Saab'. After a slight dip, it rebounded strongly, with its total collection estimated at a staggering Rs 813 crore nett, Rs 976.1 crore gross, and Rs 1269.1 crore worldwide.

title: Kevin O’Leary’s big warning to US on China - Here's what he said
content: Kevin O'Leary, a prominent Canadian investor, voices a concerning warning about the AI surge in America: it's on a collision course with an energy crisis. He points out that while China's energy infrastructure is evolving rapidly—with an impressive addition of 500 gigawatts—the U.S. has shockingly added 'zero.

title: ‘Told on good authority’: Trump says protester 'killings' in Iran ‘stopping’
content: President Donald Trump stated Iran's executions are halting. He received this information from a reliable source. Trump had previously assured protestors of US support. His administration is reviewing options, including diplomatic and military actions. Reports indicate thousands have been killed by Iranian security forces during recent protests.

title: 'Her family warned her': Gisele Bündchen’s family favored Tom Brady over Valente
content: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: Knicks vs Kings injury report: Injured players, TV info & team stats
content: The New York Knicks, a healthy Eastern Conference contender, face a depleted Sacramento Kings squad on January 14, 2026.  Injuries sideline key Kings players like Sabonis and Murray, forcing reliance on DeRozan and Westbrook.  New York, bolstered by Josh Hart's return, aims to leverage their defensive strength against a struggling Sacramento team.

title: NHL trade rumors: Senators eye blockbuster trade for Flames star Rasmus Andersson
content: Ottawa's season has faltered, prompting general manager Steve Staios to explore trade options, with defenseman Rasmus Andersson of the Calgary Flames reportedly on their radar. A potential move for Andersson hinges on his willingness to sign an extension with the Senators, as other teams also express interest.

title: Verizon outage disrupts services across US: Mobile, data users hit; tens of thousands report ‘SOS’ mode
content: Verizon experienced a widespread outage on Wednesday, affecting mobile and data services for tens of thousands of customers across the United States. Users reported "SOS" messages on their devices as the disruption began just after noon and persisted into the evening. Verizon acknowledged the issue, stating engineering teams were actively working to restore connectivity as quickly as possible.

title: 'Body is gone': Cremated after mistaken ID, man found alive after 3 weeks
content: Police mistakenly cremated a man they believed to be murder victim Sushil Kumar. Weeks later, Kumar was found alive and confused, forcing police to reopen the case and identify the real victim. His brothers had identified the burned body based on a tattoo and appearance, but Kumar's reappearance has complicated the investigation.

title: Easy to score runs in ODIs? India legend slams Manjrekar for Kohli remark
content: Harbhajan Singh slammed Sanjay Manjrekar’s claim that Virat Kohli chose the “easiest format” by sticking to ODIs, saying scoring runs is never easy. Defending Kohli’s impact and legacy, Harbhajan called him a match-winner in any format. Manjrekar’s remarks sparked debate after Kohli’s strong ODI form, including a recent 93 against New Zealand.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' actor Vijay gets fresh CBI summons, to appear on January 19
content: Actor Vijay has been summoned again by the CBI on January 19 in Delhi regarding the Karur stampede tragedy that claimed 41 lives. He reportedly told the agency his party was responsible. Meanwhile, the Supreme Court will hear a plea for CBFC clearance for Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan' on January 15, amidst Kamal Haasan's call for film certification reform.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Singer was drunk, took off life vest, Singapore court told
content: Assamese music icon Zubeen Garg drowned off Singapore's Lazarus Island while heavily intoxicated, a coroner's court heard. Toxicology revealed hypertension and epilepsy medication, but no other drugs. Singapore police suspect no foul play, while Assam authorities pursue murder charges against seven individuals, citing financial motives. The inquiry aims to clarify the circumstances of Garg's death.

title: How Delhi’s failure to house homeless hides behind numbers; 20k beds in files
content: Delhi's official records boast nearly 20,000 beds for the homeless, yet ground checks reveal a stark reality of significantly fewer available spots. Many shelters operate at a fraction of their claimed capacity, with a severe shortage of beds and mattresses. This discrepancy leaves thousands without adequate shelter, despite government assurances and a persistent problem over years.

title: From Chabahar to Kashmir: Why chaos in Iran hurts India, benefits China & Pakistan
content: India watches Iran's protests with unease, fearing a weakened state would disrupt its strategic environment. Iran serves as India's vital western corridor to Central Asia via Chabahar Port and a crucial counterweight to Pakistan's regional influence. A collapse risks jeopardizing connectivity projects and India's multi-alignment policy.

title: NHL rumors: Devils eye trading $9m defenseman Dougie Hamilton amid struggles
content: Dougie Hamilton's name is circulating in trade rumors. Several National Hockey League teams are watching the New Jersey Devils defenseman. No immediate trade is expected. Hamilton's contract and cap hit are factors. Teams like Utah and Detroit have cap space and assets. Toronto and Vegas face cap challenges. The situation remains dynamic as the trade deadline approaches.

title: 'Return home': Pakistan's Rizwan asked to leave BBL after 'retired out' call
content: Mohammad Rizwan's 'retired out' decision in the BBL sparked debate in Pakistan, with some calling it disrespectful. Former cricketer Kamran Akmal acknowledged the situation but stressed the need for modern T20 players to adapt their strike rate to evolving league demands.

title: Dev Anand waited outside Amitabh Bachchan’s Jalsa for book launch
content: Dev Anand’s 2007 autobiography launch was expected to be a star-studded celebration, but it quietly turned into an awkward episode. Years later, his close associate Mohan Churiwala recalled how the legendary actor was left waiting outside Amitabh Bachchan’s Jalsa, leaving Dev Anand wondering if he had unknowingly upset someone.

title: Cavaliers vs 76ers injury report: Key players out, stats & watch guide
content: The Cleveland Cavaliers face the Philadelphia 76ers in a crucial Eastern Conference matchup. Both teams are vying for playoff positioning, with Philadelphia entering as slight favorites at home. Key players like Donovan Mitchell and Tyrese Maxey are expected to lead their respective offenses in what promises to be a high-scoring contest.

title: Claire Kittle recalls yelling 'get up' during Kittle's achilles tear scare
content: George Kittle, the popular star player, sparked panic among fans as he sustained a brutal injury on Sunday night at the match against the Philadelphia Eagles even though the team ended up winning the match. Amid all the mess, George Kittle's wife, Claire Kittle, has stood by him and has now shared what she felt as she saw him sustaining the brutal injury.

title: 'Fundamental disagreement’: Denmark discusses Greenland with US; urges 'respectful' cooperation
content: US President Trump's renewed calls for NATO to help acquire Greenland have met with a 'fundamental disagreement' from Danish and Greenlandic officials.  Despite US pressure, Denmark announced plans to bolster its military presence in the Arctic, citing an unpredictable security environment.  Greenlandic representatives questioned the US approach, highlighting low local support for annexation.

title: Trump who? At $1.2tn, China's trade surplus hits new high in 2025 - despite US tariffs
content: US-bound shipments did fall sharply after Donald Trump raised duties in 2025. But under Xi Jinping's guidance, Chinese exporters responded with speed and ingenuity. Sales surged instead to Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. In many cases, goods were routed through third countries, blunting the effect of US tariffs altogether.

title: US freezes visa processing: Is India in the list? Check the complete details
content: The US State Department has halted immigrant visa processing for 75 countries, including Somalia, Russia, and Pakistan, effective January 21. This indefinite pause is part of a reassessment of visa processing procedures. The department aims to crack down on applicants as part of this new initiative.

title: Alexx O’Nell: ‘Being easy to work with often valued more than honesty’ - Exclusive
content: Bollywood often celebrates glamour, success, and box-office numbers, but behind the spotlight lie struggles that rarely make it into public conversations. In an exclusive interview with ETimes, Alexx O’Nell—an American-born actor and musician who has built a prolific, nearly two-decade-long career across Indian cinema in languages including Hindi, Bengali, Tamil, and Malayalam—speaks candidly about loneliness, judgment, silence, and the structural changes he believes can make the film industry healthier for the next generation.

title: Sources: Young to be out through All-Star break
content: New Wizards star Trae Young is still recovering from MCL and quad injuries on his right leg and will be reevaluated after the All-Star break, sources told ESPN.

title: 49ers' Warner not ruling out return vs. Seahawks
content: 49ers linebacker Fred Warner made it clear Wednesday that he hasn't ruled out returning from a fractured and dislocated right ankle as soon as Saturday night.

title: Source: Commanders to hire son of Doug Williams
content: The Commanders are hiring D.J. Williams, the son of franchise great Doug Williams, to be their quarterbacks coach, the latest addition to a new-look staff under Dan Quinn.

title: NCAA asks CFTC to suspend prediction markets
content: The NCAA asked a federal regulatory body to stop prediction markets from offering trades on college sports until more safeguards are in place.

title: LB Styles joins Buckeyes stars declaring for draft
content: Linebacker Sonny Styles, who is ESPN insider Mel Kiper's No. 7 overall prospect, became the fifth Ohio State star to declare for the 2026 NFL draft.

title: QB Moore opts against draft, returning to Ducks
content: Oregon QB Dante Moore, who was projected as a top pick in the NFL draft, has decided to return to school for the 2026 season, he announced on ESPN's "SportsCenter."

title: Ingram, Suh, Donald to enter College Football HOF
content: Mark Ingram, the first Alabama player to win the Heisman Trophy, and Ndamukong Suh and Aaron Donald, two of the most fearsome defensive linemen of their era, highlight the 2026 College Football Hall of Fame class announced Wednesday.

title: Arbeloa: Madrid Copa exit to 2nd-tier side 'painful'
content: New Real Madrid coach Álvaro Arbeloa took responsibility for the team's "painful" 3-2 Copa del Rey defeat to second-tier Albacete on Wednesday, defending his decision to rest a number of senior players.

title: Who deserves to make the NBA All-Star team: We made 25 picks
content: Locks? Bubble watch? A bonus 25th player?! We're unveiling our 2026 rosters full of legends, first-timers and a few difficult cuts.

title: Ranking all 32 rookie classes in the NFL: There's the top four ... then everybody else
content: How does every NFL team's rookie group stack up? Aaron Schatz ranked all 32 based on first-year production, starting with surprises up top.

title: Nine teams that need to turn around their seasons -- now
content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

title: Barnwell: How did the Steelers end up here, and should they lean into a rebuild under a new coach?
content: Mike Tomlin and the Steelers have parted ways. But will Pittsburgh now change its roster-building approach under the next coach? And who should replace Tomlin?

title: Nine open NFL coaching jobs, nine predicted hires: Who will land in Baltimore, Pittsburgh, New York?
content: Could three coaches who were just fired immediately find new NFL teams? We projected candidates to fill open jobs.

title: Updated NBA mock draft: Projecting who lands at Nos. 1 through 30
content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

title: How Seahawks started over at QB with Sam Darnold and got back to the playoffs
content: It's been 10 months since the Seahawks traded Geno Smith and signed Darnold. Now they're back in the playoffs.

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: A slam for Scheffler? What's next for Rory? Storylines to watch heading into 2026 PGA Tour season
content: What will the biggest names on tour do in 2026? What will Brooks Koepka's return look like? We dive into some of the biggest stories to watch as the season gets started

title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

title: Arsenal take first step to end long-standing semifinal curse
content: In a thriller at Stamford Bridge, Mikel Arteta's Arsenal took a major step toward ending a major trophy drought.

title: Why did Man United, Chelsea, Real Madrid all sack their managers? It's about culture
content: Why have three of the biggest soccer teams in the world fired their managers in the span of just 12 days? To clubs like Man United or Real Madrid, it's not about results, but how they fit.

title: Cancelo isn't the center back Flick wanted, but might be the fullback Barça need
content: João Cancelo's return to Barcelona began in confusion, but his loan move could give the team a boost.

title: How Miami offensive coordinator Shannon Dawson emerged from nowhere
content: The architect of the Hurricane offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

title: What would a Russian Olympic hockey team look like in 2026?
content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

title: Boxing fights we want to see in 2026: Haney-Garcia 2, Canelo-Benavidez, more
content: A lot of major fights took place in 2025 -- but which megafights do we want to see in the year ahead?

title: Supreme Court takes up transgender athlete cases
content: The Supreme Court got complex arguments and passionate demonstrations as it considered two cases related to transgender athletes.

title: NFL divisional round odds, early bets: Seahawks favored vs. 49ers; Rams over Bears
content: Our early bets for the NFL divisional round, plus spreads, lines, totals and FPI analysis for every game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Kanté to return to Europe?
content: French midfielder N'Golo Kanté could make his return to Europe playing in Turkey. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Voting underway for high-stakes civic polls in Maharashtra; all eyes on big battle for Mumbai
content: Except for Mumbai, the other urban bodies have multi-member wards. Vote count will take place on January 16

title: How are cryptocurrency exchanges in India vetting customers? | Explained
content: Cryptocurrency exchanges in India use a range of methods to verify their customers and prevent money-laundering and the financing of terrorism

title: Air India says flights overflying Iran will use alternative route, warns of delays
content: The company said in a statement that some Air India flights where currently rerouting is not possible are being cancelled

title: Maharashtra civic polls LIVE: Voting begins for Mumbai BMC elections, 28 other municipal corporations
content: In the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), 1,700 candidates are vying for 227 seats in elections being held after nine years, after a four-year delay

title: Uproar as rats roam near beds, oxygen pipes in Gonda Hospital; Opposition raises concern for patient safety
content: With the video going viral, the Opposition alleged that the health infrastructure in the State is in a shambles

title: City coughs, sputters, as Bhogi fires burn; 4 stations record poor air quality
content: TNPCB data showed that in the 24 hours ending 8 a.m. on Tuesday, four stations out of 15, registered poor air quality

title: Villagers in Odisha seek restoration of land as thermal power plant fails to take off
content: They alleged corporate went into liquidation and right to transfer land parcels was given to another company without taking them into confidence

title: Bihar Chief Secretary makes geo-spatial approval mandatory for DPRs of infra projects above ₹50 crore
content: Departments were instructed to incorporate geo-spatial inputs at the planning stage itself to avoid technical, administrative, and land-related obstacles at later stages.

title: Indore water contamination: Medical panel pegs death toll at 15
content: The panel, consisting of five doctors from the government-run Mahatma Gandhi Medical (MGM) College, has submitted a report to the State authorities confirming 15 deaths even as the official figure remains at six

title: Political parties make pitch for 2027 Punjab election at Maghi Mela
content: AAP govt. will make provision in budget to give ₹1,000 per month to every woman, says Mann; Akali Dal chief lists poll promises; BJP holds first independent political rally at annual gathering

title: Suvendu warns West Bengal CM of legal action over coal scam remarks
content: In a post on X, the Leader of the Opposition claimed that the deadline given to Mamata Banerjee to respond to a defamation notice served by him had expired

title: Tej Pratap urges younger brother Tejashwi Yadav to merge RJD into his party
content: He said this on the occasions of Dahi-Chura feast which he has organised at his residence in Patna. Even his father and RJD Chief Lalu Prasad also attended the feast who had once expelled him from the party and snapped even family ties with him.

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | From melody to motion, students dazzle on festival stage
content: The 64th State School Arts Festival opens in Thrissur with dazzling performances by high school girls in the light music contest, alongside Mohiniyattam, group dance, and myriad art forms. Thousands of participants and spectators celebrate the talent, culture, and rich artistic heritage.

title: Lokayukta registers case over large-scale government land scam in Nagamangala taluk
content: The accused include serving and former government officials and private individuals. A  criminal case has been registered against 11 persons in connection with the scam, and five government officials have been arrested.

title: Conditions favourable for cessation of NE monsoon; fog to continue in A.P.
content: Except for two, districts in Andhra Pradesh have either recorded excess or normal rainfall during south-west and north-east monsoon seasons

title: Centre asks A.P. to expand PPP model to ensure better healthcare services
content: State Health Secretary receives a letter containing suggestions in key areas of nuclear medicine, radiology, cancer daycare centres, dental clinics and mobile medical units

title:
Mumbai model to help build 
self-financing cities in Andhra Pradesh
content: A delegation from the State, during a recent two-day tour, studied advanced practices in regional governance, land-based financing, transit-oriented development and slum redevelopment in Mumbai Metropolitan Region

title: BSF, ITBP and NIA get new chiefs
content: Shatrujeet Singh Kapoor for ITBP, Praveen Kumar for BSF and Rakesh Aggarwal for NIA were proposed by the Home Ministry

title: TET results sparks concern among in-service teachers, unions seek exemption
content: Test outcome triggers a debate, with teacher unions arguing that when more than half of the teachers fail to qualify, it clearly indicates that the examination does not reflect classroom teaching competencies

title: Australia classifies Indian students ‘high-risk’, tightens visa scrutiny
content: It improves quality over quantity, say experts; this means requiring detailed financial proof, full traceability of source of funds, a strict ‘Genuine Student’ assessment, which may include interviews, and slower and manual checks of documentation

title: 29 Maharashtra civic bodies go to polls on January 15; Mumbai is big prize
content: More than 3.48 crore voters will cast their votes to choose 2,869 corporators from among 15,908 candidates; Votes will be counted on January 16

title: Uncontested victories in Mumbai local polls valid under the law: Bombay High Court
content: The opposition claimed that mass withdrawals were not ‘voluntary’ and Mahayuti allies used coercion, forcing candidates to withdraw

title: Cong leader booked for threatening and abusing Municipal Commissioner
content: The Congress leader threatened the Municipal Commissioner over a flex and banner to promote Kannada film Cult that was removed for violating norms

title: Maharashtra Votes In Civic Body Polls, High-Stakes Battle In Mumbai, Pune: 10 Points
content: 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra are voting today, with the spotlight on Mumbai, where the BJP and Shiv Sena are locked in an intense battle with the Thackeray brothers and the NCP.

title: After Trump Threats, Iran Says There Will Be "No Hanging Today Or Tomorrow"
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Wednesday there would not be any "hanging today or tomorrow," despite earlier vows from Tehran to fast-track trials for protesters.

title: Pak, Bangladesh, Iran: List Of 75 Nations Facing US Immigrant Visa Pause
content: The Donald Trump administration has indefinitely suspended the processing of immigrant visas from 75 countries in one of its most expansive efforts yet to restrict legal entry pathways to the United States.

title: Maharashtra Elections 2026 Live Updates: Voting Across 29 Civic Bodies Begins
content: Maharashtra Elections 2026 Voting Day: The spotlight is on the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), India's richest civic body with an annual budget of over Rs 74, 400 crore, where 1,700 candidates are vying for 227 seat.

title: US Envoy Sergio Gor Pledges To Boost Defence, Trade, Technology With India
content: United States Ambassador to India Sergio Gor presented his credentials to President Droupadi Murmu during an official ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Wednesday.

title: Sunjay Kapur's Children Sought Criminal Action Against Priya: Sources
content: The Sunjay Kapur will case has escalated, with Samaira and Kiaan Kapur, the children of Karisma Kapoor, seeking criminal action against their father's second wife, Priya Kapur, from court, sources have told NDTV.

title: Amid Trump Threats, Greenland Says More NATO Troops "In Coming Days"
content: More NATO troops are heading to Greenland, the Arctic island's deputy prime minister said on Wednesday, after a White House meeting between US, Danish and Greenlandic leaders.

title: Shehbaz Sharif Says Several Countries In Talks With Pak For Fighter Jets
content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday claimed that several countries were in talks with Pakistan to acquire its fighter jets following last year's conflict with India.

title: US To Halt Issuing Immigrant Visas For 75 Nations, Including Pak, Bangladesh: Report
content: The State Department said Wednesday it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries, including Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh.

title: US Senate Blocks Effort To Rein In Trump's Venezuela War Powers
content: US Senate Republicans voted on Wednesday against a resolution that would have barred President Donald Trump from further military action in Venezuela without Congress' authorization.

title: Maharashtra Civic Polls 2026: What Is Open And Closed Today
content: The Maharashtra government has declared January 15 a public holiday in all regions where the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections will be held.

title: Elon Musk's X To Prevent Grok AI Users From Undressing Images
content: Elon Musk's platform X on Wednesday announced measures to prevent its AI chatbot Grok from undressing images of real people, following global backlash over its generation of sexualized images of women and children.

title: "Making Tremendous Progress": Trump Praises New Venezuela Leader After Call
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday he had held a "long call" with Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodriguez, the first known contact between the two leaders since the ouster of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Amid Iran Unrest, UK Temporarily Closes Embassy In Tehran
content: The British embassy in Tehran has been temporarily closed, the government said on Wednesday. "We have temporarily closed the British Embassy in Tehran, this will now operate

title: Trump Imposes 25% Tariff On Imports Of Some Advanced Computing Chips
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday imposed a 25% tariff on certain advanced computing chips, such as the Nvidia H200 AI processor and a similar semiconductor from AMD called the MI325X, according to a fact sheet released by the White House.

title: NASA Astronauts Begin Early Return Flight From ISS With Ailing Crew Member
content: A SpaceX capsule departed the International Space Station on Wednesday carrying a four-member crew on an emergency return flight to Earth necessitated by an unspecified serious medical condition afflicting one of the astronauts aboard.

title: Germany, France To Send Troops To Greenland As Trump Ramps Up Pressure
content: Germany's army will send troops to Greenland along with other European countries, Berlin said on Wednesday, as US President Donald Trump ramped up his threats to conquer the Danish Arctic island.

title: Venezuela Looking To "New Era'" After Maduro Ouster, Says Interim President
content: enezuela's interim president Delcy Rodriguez declared Wednesday her country was entering a new era marked by greater tolerance towards political rivals, following the US ouster of her former boss Nicolas Maduro.

title: Killings, Executions Of Iran Protesters Have "Stopped", Claims Trump
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he's been told "on good authority" that plans for executions in Iran have stopped, even as Tehran has indicated fast trials and executions ahead in its crackdown on protesters.

title: Denmark Says "Fundamental Disagreement" Remains After Greenland Talks With US
content: Denmark's foreign minister said Wednesday that a "fundamental disagreement" over Greenland remains with President Donald Trump after talks in Washington with Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Nipah-hit Bengal nurses critical; two contacts hospitalised
content: One nurse is in coma and the other is on ventilator support; 120 people who came into contact with them have been directed to isolate themselves; State govt. launches helpline to guide public

title: Meitei, Kuki-Zo insurgent groups warned against violating ground rules, continuing extortion
content: MHA, State officials conduct joint review of insurgent groups; UNLF-P, a Meitei group, asked to return looted weapons to police armouries; Kuki-Zo groups asked to relocate seven camps, enforce ground rules

title: KIIFB model should be modernised to turbocharge State’s infrastructure development, says Thomas Isaac
content: Kerala’s new developmental phase can be meaningfully realised by preparing and implementing an action plan focused on a knowledge economy that builds upon the advances made in education, says former Finance Minister

title: UGC brings out new rules against caste discrimination
content: Higher education institutions may lose recognition if they violate the regulations; UGC brings OBCs under the ambit of new rules after their exclusion in the draft version evoked criticism; commission drops proposal to impose penalty for false complaint

title: Marriage halls seek reduction in GST rates, power charges
content: The Tamil Nadu Marriage Hall Owners Association, South India Marriage Hall Owners Federation, and All Kalyana Mandapam Owners Association have jointly written to the respective State governments and the Centre seeking a significant reduction in GST rates

content: Parties are scouting candidates and coming up with strategies to strike a chord with a new generation of voters.

content: Experts are split over voter turnout and air quality remains forgotten as city votes after nine years

content: In a notice issued on December 23, Kerala Motor Vehicles department had directed the online delivery app companies in Kerala to follow road safety rules and make it part of their corporate policy

title: Jana Nayagan row: Supreme Court to hear producer’s appeal on January 15
content: The Bench would hear KVN Productions’ challenge against the decision of a two-judge Bench of the High Court to stay a single judge’s order to issue U/A 16+ certificate to the film, hours after it was passed.

title: Police profiling of mosques as crime sites is an attempt to strip Muslims of faith: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Imams, caretakers summoned to police stations, asked to submit extensive personal data, creating fear amomng worshippers, says PDP chief; order for police verification of mosques issued by L-G’s office, says NC

title: Farmers raise concerns over paddy procurement through coop. societies
content: They argue that cooperative societies lack both the expertise to manage large-scale procurement efficiently and the ability to pay farmers within two days of collection

content: In the complaint, T.B. Mini says Ernakulam District and Principal Sessions Judge Honey M. Varghese, who pronounced the verdict in the case, made derogatory remarks against her

content: One of the important specifications for the computers was to have cameras, which, however, are not in the 17 computers supplied

Yet students prepare for these events with equal diligence, even when their achievements rarely draw public acclaim

title: Parasakthi team celebrates Pongal with Prime Minister Modi in New Delhi
content: Actors Sivakarthikeyan, Ravi Mohan and music composer G.V. Prakash Kumar, who are part of the film that themed around the anti-Hindi agitations in Madras in the mid-1960s, attended the event

title: Farmers’ march led by Hanuman Beniwal to Jaipur called off after high-voltage drama
content: Mr. Beniwal, critical of the BJP government in the State, says the dharna at Riyan Badi had sent across a ‘historic message’ to the government to render justice to the people waiting for resolution of their grievances

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu stresses NDA government’s commitment to safeguarding and propagating Telugu traditions
content: At the Bhogi celebrations conducted at his ancestral village at Naravaripalle, he highlights the importance of tracing one’s cultural roots

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026: Classical wit meets contemporary pulse as young satirists take centre stage
content: Performances at the school arts festival reaffirms that Kerala’s classical art forms continue to evolve, engage, and entertain — gracefully bridging tradition with the pulse of the present

title: Shiv Sena leader seeks action against police officer for misleading court
content: The demand by religious head Siddalinga Swami comes after a court penalises Somaling Kiradalli for furnishing false information

title: Doc among 3 killed by Chinese manja on Makar Sankranti
content: Courts and state govts have banned Chinese manja but enforcement has struggled to keep pace with demand

title: Deported to Bangladesh, widow moves SC, says born in India, 16 of family in NRC
content: a 43-year-old widow from Assam was deported recently to Bangladesh . she is accused of wrongly declaring an illegal migrant . all 16 members of her family are in the national Register of Citizens . the petitioner's family list shows that every member of the family has been categorised as accepted in the final NRC .

title: Train fare formula is a trade secret, cannot be disclosed, Railways tells CIC
content: the classification and methodology of fixing fares of different classes in passenger train falls in the domain of "trade secret/intellectual property rights" this was disclosed while the CIC dismissed an application seeking detailed information on the base fare calculation mechanism for train tickets . the online application had asked railways to specify the components, parameters, dynamic pricing mechanisms, seasonal variations or other relevant factors .

title: If religious places are to be profiled, then start with temples: Mehbooba Mufti
content: mehbooba mufti denounces what she called 'profiling of mosques' by police . she says it amounted to interference in religious affairs and was an attempt to humiliate Kashmiri Muslims . police are now seeking photographs, Aadhaar numbers and other personal details of imams and mosque management members .

title: Kathua anti-terror op intensified, cordon extended
content: the cordon-and-search operation in Najote was launched based on intelligence inputs about the presence of terrorists in the area . the region lies near Kamadh Nallah in Kahog forest belt, where an encounter had erupted on Jan 7 .

title: 70% of 41 crore vehicles fail to meet statutory compliances
content: over 70% of 40.7 crore vehicles, mostly two-wheelers, in the country do not comply with some or other norms . the data, shared with states and UTs in a meeting last week, showed over two-thirds of these non-compliant vehicles - approximately 23.5 crore . officials say a large number of vehicles in the Vahan database are legally or operationally not fit to ply .

title: LeT commander calls for Hindu genocide
content: Representative image Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: British Sikhs rescue schoolgirl from flat, say she was groomed by Afghan man
content: around 200 sikh men and women surrounded council flat in hounslow . they said a 34-year-old man groomed a 16-year old girl . the girl had been meeting the man since the age of 14 or 15 .

title: AI on the couch: Chatbots 'recall' childhood trauma, fear & shame
content: AI image Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the  Super Bowl . The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams .  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round.  Houston Texans  round out the AFC contenders, with the  Chicago Bears  and  San Francisco 49ers  considered longshots, as they face the favorites in the divisional round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: CFP National Title first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: Power Rankings: How the SEC is shaping the national title race
content: the day-to-day challenges of January are key in putting that picture together . the AP-ranked SEC currently has nine teams battling each other for supremacy . they have already met this season in a game that didn't count in the standings .

title: Teams winning the MLB offseason so far -- and those that need to make a big move soon
content: major league baseball's free agent pool remains flush with talent this winter . there are big bats, a front-of-the-rotation arm, power, veteran pitchers and even an every-day catcher . the reality, particularly for teams playing at the top of the market, is that this might be their last opportunity to land a bat in free agency for years .

title: 'How many tackles can one man break!?' Remembering Tommie Frazier and the greatest run in national title history
content: quarterback Tommie Frazier scores a touchdown in the 1996 cornhuskers' win . he ducked under a defensive end late in the third quarter of the 1995 national championship . nine Gators got a hand on Frazier, but none could bring him down .

title: NL Central urgency ratings: How much work each team still needs to do
content: the difference in offseason activity level in the national league central has been stark . on the other side of the division, the Chicago Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates have been active in attempting to improve for the 2026 season . we've assigned each team an urgency rating -- from 1 to 5 .

title: Preseason top 25 and how to watch
content: all college baseball on ESPN, ESPN2, ESPNU, SEC Network, ACC Network, Big 12 Now on ESPN+, ESPN3, ESPN+ and ACCNX is available on the ESPN App . a team from the SEC has been dominating college baseball as of late .

title: Clips to Thunder, Pels to Hawks and more NBA draft assets to watch at the trade deadline
content: the Grizzlies are entertaining offers to potentially move Ja Morant before the trade deadline . the new york Knicks will get Washington's first-rounder if it falls outside of the top 8 . nearly half of the league's franchises don't control their pick .

title: 🏈 Transfer portal: Teams that found best fits
content: the transfer portal is now college football's most immediate roster-shaping tool . it's capable of changing a program's trajectory in a single offseason . we ranked the 15 best portal additions based on providing the greatest fit and value .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Suns on the rise, Celtics backslide
content: the 2026 trade deadline is right around the league (Feb. 5, 3 p.m. ET) and teams are hitting the midseason mark . the biggest name to kick off this trade season was Trae Young . ja Morant, star guard for the Memphis Grizzlies , is officially available .
